001 /**
002 * This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. 
003 * "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game.
004 * 
005 * This class holds an enumeration table of all command words known to the game.
006 * It is used to recognise commands as they are typed in.
007 *
008 * @author  Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes + D.Bureau
009 * @version 2008.03.30 + 2019.09.25
010 */
011public class CommandWords
012{
013    /** 
014     * a constant array that will hold all valid command words
015     * porté privée
016     */
017    private static final String aValidCommands[] = {
018        "go",
019        "help",
020        "quit",
021        "look",
022        "eat",
023        "back"
024    };
025
026    /**
027     * Print all valid commands
028     * 
029     * @return List of available commands
030     */
031    public String getCommandList(){
032        StringBuilder vCommandList = new StringBuilder();
033        
034        for(String vCommand : CommandWords.aValidCommands){
035            vCommandList.append(" " + vCommand);
036        }
037        
038        return vCommandList.toString();
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * Check whether a given String is a valid command word. 
043     * 
044     * @param pString String to analyze
045     * @return true if a given string is a valid command,
046     * false if it isn't.
047     */
048    public boolean isCommand( final String pString )
049    {
050        for ( int vI=0; vI<this.aValidCommands.length; vI++ ) {
051            if ( this.aValidCommands[vI].equals( pString ) )
052                return true;
053        } // for
054        // if we get here, the string was not found in the commands :
055        return false;
056    } // isCommand()
057} // CommandWords
